byline.contributor: Barbara Liston contributed reporting from Altamonte Springs, Fla., and Rick Rojas and Eli Rosenberg from New York. Susan C. Beachy and Doris Burke contributed research.
byline.original: By KIM BARKER and NATE SCHWEBER

abstract: Baffled acquaintances describe Jennifer Berry, who stands accused of killing her newborn baby by throwing it from window of apartment building in Bronx, as sweet and shy; case has prompted officials to reexamine 2008 death of Berry's infant son, which was at time attributed to infant death syndrome.
lead_paragraph: Jennifer Berry, accused of throwing her newborn from a seventh-floor Bronx apartment, was considered soft-spoken by her peers and had worked for a number of social service agencies.

headline.main: A ‘Sweet and Shy’ Woman, Now Accused of Killing Her Newborn
headline.print_headline: A Woman Called ‘Sweet and Shy,’ Now Accused of Killing Her Newborn

snippet: Jennifer Berry, accused of throwing her newborn from a seventh-floor Bronx apartment, was considered soft-spoken by her peers and had worked for a number of social service agencies.
